Parsers

Class CParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • Parsers.CParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CParserExt

    public abstract class CParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements IParser
    CParser is the base class for all parsers. Every parser class has CParser as a superclass. All parsers implement the methods of this class.

      • fParseErrorList

        protected java.util.ArrayList<CParseError> fParseErrorList
        Stores error messages generated during the parsing process.

        The error list is empty if the parser didn't find any errors.

      • reSet

        public void reSet()
        Description copied from interface: IParser
        Resets the parser state.

        The state is set as follows:

        • Removes all the error messages from the error list. The list will be empty after this call returns.
        • Moves the cursor to the beginning of the stream attached to this parser.
        • Resets the result state of this parser by setting the success property to false and frees the tree.
        Specified by:
        reSet in interface IParser

      • nextSym

        public void nextSym()
        Description copied from interface: IParser

      • term

        public void term(int aSym)
          throws InvalidTerminalException
        Description copied from interface: IParser
        Matches the current symbol (without data) from the stream with the lookahead symbol specified.

        If the symbols match, the cursor is moved to the next symbol in the stream. Otherwise, an InvalidTerminalException is thrown.

        Specified by:
        term in interface IParser
        Parameters:
        aSym - The code of the lookahead symbol.
        Throws:
        InvalidTerminalException - if the current symbol from the stream does not match the lookahead symbol aSym.

      • termData

        public java.lang.String termData(int aSym)
                          throws InvalidTerminalException
        Description copied from interface: IParser
        Matches the current symbol (with data) from the stream with the lookahead symbol and returns its data.

        If the symbols match, the data of the current symbol is obtained and the cursor is moved to the next symbol in the stream. Otherwise, an InvalidTerminalException is thrown.

        Specified by:
        termData in interface IParser
        Parameters:
        aSym - The code of the lookahead symbol.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidTerminalException

      • getNonTerminalName

        public java.lang.String getNonTerminalName(int i)
        Parameters:
        i -
        Returns:

      • parse

        public abstract CParserResult parse()
        Description copied from interface: IParser
        Begins the process of deriving a given sentence based on the given grammar.

        The method is abstract and any descendants of CParser should implement it to provide customized parsing.

        Specified by:
        parse in interface IParser
        Returns:
        true and a parse tree if the sentence belongs to the language of the grammar. false and no parse tree otherwise.

      • parseNonTerminal

        public abstract CParserResult parseNonTerminal(java.lang.String aName)
        Description copied from interface: IParser
        Begins the process of deriving a given sentence based on the given grammar and at the start expression specified.

        The method is abstract and any descendants of CParser should implement it to provide customized parsing.

        Specified by:
        parseNonTerminal in interface IParser
        Parameters:
        aName - The Nonterminal to be used as the start expression.
        Returns:
        true and a parse tree if the sentence belongs to the language of the grammar. false and no parse tree otherwise.
        See Also:
        CParserResult
